author: manfo2021
title: Spread Plutus through Africa
description: Большинство проектов в Африке избегают интеграции на Cardano, учитывая резкую кривую обучения, которую смарт-контракты и Plutus приносят разработчикам.

f6_assessments.q0: I would like to begin by congratulating the team on an excellent proposal. It is evident that the team has put considerable effort, strategy, and knowledge into its making. Here, it is argued that the majority of projects in Africa avoid integrating with Cardano because of the difficult growth curve involved in using Plutus. In order to address this challenge, it is proposed to use the Wada hub to implement a strategy to train developers using a project-based curriculum. Of all the solutions presented, the one that I believe best addresses this problem is the third one where meetings will be held to enable developers and entrepreneurs in the area to network with one another. Both the strategic objective and the success metrics of this proposal are aligned with the objectives of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team proposes an implementation plan divided into seven phases, in which the first phase is dedicated to developing the curriculum and training the trainers, and culminates in a consolidation phase, where all the knowledge gained during the project is applied in preparation for the next strategic phase: expansion. An in-depth description of the project members is provided, however no references are cited to verify them. Furthermore, the WADA partnership is considered a strong element, however, the name of the contact person(s) of this organization who will provide support for implementation of this proposal is not provided. This budget is divided into seven identifiable items, which allows one to clearly understand the logic used to request the final amount. Finally, I would like to express a concern that I have. The proposal team has 10 proposals in this catalyst cycle and most of the proposals mention the same people. While some of them complement this proposal (which I believe to be totally valid), I identify other risks that should have been identified, analyzed, and addressed. It would have been useful to explain, for example, how will people assigned to these projects be allocated and controlled in order to minimize the risk of delay in the proposed schedule due to dispersion of work.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides all the necessary information needed to conduct a thorough auditability assessment, along with a roadmap that offers sufficient information to understand the implementation process. As well, appropriate, concrete, and sufficient impact metrics were presented to compare what was executed with what was planned.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I know how important decentralised communities are for democratic and economic empowerment. This knowledge gives me the skills to assessproposals in this challenge. The proposal identifies an important problem within the challenge which by adressing it, will bring a great benefit to the Catalyst community and the Cardano ecosystem - by empowering developers to work competently on the Cardano Network. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings.
Since WADA is a great multiplicator and keeps establishing,  it can sure be said that the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
WADA are a really active and established part of the Catalyst community. Without a doubt they will be able to successfully implement this proposal. The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and basically have a large group as their support network. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable and roadmap to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is a great example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Well-defined, detailed metrics and an auditable roadmap are presented that define the success of the proposal. A clear, understandable problem description is supplemented by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution.

f6_assessments.q0:
"This Proposal has a huge impact on the development of Cardano in Africa and it will help develop the developer team in Africa in general and Camaroon in particular. With a good team of developers, they will be able to create projects that solve their own problems. I love the idea of this african hackathon. It will give a great impetus for people to create projects that solve problems in Africa and Cardano

Besides, building courses in English and French will help more people access these courses"
f6_assessments.q1:
"WADA is a team that has completed many proposals on catalyst and is also a reputable organization in Africa for the development of Cardano in Africa. Therefore, the supervision of WADA can ensure the success of the proposal. They are also established 
In addition, with team members who are able to use many languages and have over 12 years of programming experience, completing the proposal is completely feasible."
f6_assessments.q2:
"The proposer has outlined the costs, roadmap and major elements of the work behind this proposal. All is based on already happening activities, which need to be fairly funded now. 

We can track the results of the courses through the website and the team meetup is an easy way to know the outcome of the proposal.

The proposal will be easier to track and check on the success of the programs through the numbers of people taking the courses as well as the number of people participating in the hackathon"

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal to organize a blockchain innovation competition in Africa especially in Camaroon. A creative competition like this will help drive participation in building contributions on the blockchain platform faster and more. Especially in difficult economic regions like Africa, this is necessary and helps to better promote economic development here.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has had many successful proposals before on the Cardano platform in Africa. Along with 12 years of experience in the field of engineering. That shows that this is a team that works seriously and wants to go long with projects.
f6_assessments.q2: For an educational proposal as well as a creative contest organized like this we usually check the project performance by the number of events, courses, the number of participants at the events they attend. organized through videos and syndicated content. A website or an official youtube channel is required to see this content.

f6_assessments.q0: The proponent clearly understands what needs to be done for the proposal. Spreading Plutus through Africa, this campaign will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. The problem and solution presented makes sense and is within the scope of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Certainly the project development team is quality. They include 3 core members of Wada, no doubt capable of successfully implementing this proposal. The team has listed many benefits that the project will bring to the ecosystem. From what can be read in the proposal, the proposal has invested considerable time and effort in this project demonstrating trust and dedication. Proposing to provide documents to prove they can successfully complete the project
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap for the proposal is clear and highly transparent due to constant communication with the community during the development phase
Easy-to-follow KPIs along with a shortlist of plans after the initial 3 months increase the transparency of this project and proposal. Budget allocation seems fair and straight to the point

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal would form a Plutus developer training resource in the WADA Cameroon chapter. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge to scale community events in a technical approach.
f6_assessments.q1: The WADA team's experience and dev team are all described within the proposal. The information provided such as the feasability section and the roadmap are well scoped for this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The WADA team in Cameroon has built a strong proposal and plan to scaling up Plutus developers in this region of Africa. The roadmap information provided is sufficient to audit progress.

solution: Оснащение и обучение африканских разработчиков через камерунский центр WADA навыкам реализации смарт-контрактов с помощью Plutus.
